{"rule":"ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_RULE","sentence":"^\\QWide binaries Binaries where one of the stars is too faint to directly observe Can still be detected by following motion of the visible component.\\E$"}
{"rule":"ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_RULE","sentence":"^\\QWide binaries Binaries where one of the stars is too faint to directly observe Can still be detected by the following proper motion of the visible component Center of mass moves along, star orbits this center, showing a periodic wiggle (I wonder how this can be muddled with and/or separated from parallax.\\E$"}
{"rule":"STARS_AND_STEPS","sentence":"^\\QBinaries where one star passes in front of the other at some point during its period A partial eclipse will happen if \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q where inclination \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q is defined as the angle between the orbital plane and the plane of the sky \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q and a total eclipse will occur if\\E$"}
{"rule":"STARS_AND_STEPS","sentence":"^\\QBinaries where one star passes in front of the other at some point during its period A partial eclipse will happen if \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q where inclination \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q is defined as the angle between the orbital plane and the plane of the sky \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q and \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q is the orbital radius and a total eclipse will occur if \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q We assume that the angles between line of sight and orbital planes are random, the probability of having an angle between 0 and \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q is the fraction of the surface area of the half sphere between the pole and the circle at an angle \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q from the pole, which is equal to \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
